H0.text: Fish are also moved to the ocean's surface by upwelling, in addition to the water of the deep ocean.

H1.text: Nutrients are moved to the surface by upwelling, which brings water from the deep ocean to the ocean's surface.

H2.text: Phytoplankton are also moved to the ocean's surface by upwelling, which transports water from the deep ocean to the surface.

H3.text: Dissolved gases are moved to the surface by upwelling, which also transports water from the deep ocean to the ocean's surface.

A4.text: the availability in the surface ocean is governed by the balance between the so-called biological pump and upwelling of deep, nutrient-rich waters
